B1 sexually or romantically attracted to people of the same gender and not to people of a different gender: My aunt is gay. Mark knew he was gay by the time he was fourteen. Synonym

belonging or relating to gay people and sometimes queer people (= people who do not fit a society's traditional ideas about gender or sexuality): the gay and lesbian community gay rights We went to a gay bar.
used to describe activities that gay people do that in the past have been done mainly by straight people and which may not be allowed by an area's laws: The Courts have ruled that gay adoption (= adoption of a child by a gay person or a gay couple) is legal. He believes strongly in gay marriage. See also

(HAPPY)
old-fashioned happy: We had a gay old time down at the dance hall.
old-fashioned If a place is gay, it is bright and attractive: The streets were gay and full of people.
